page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: Llandyrnog lies in the middle of the Vale of Clwyd,on rich farmland between 0 and 100m above sea level. Most of the land is hedged although there has been some clearance of these in recent years. The Vale is well wooded in parts,with oaks,beech and sycamore commonly found.Afforestation is very noticeable on the hills around the Vale.This is softwood comprising Sitka Spruce and Larch. The River Clwyd has its source in Clocaenog Forest and winds its way through the Vale to Rhyl.Fishing is strictly controlled and trout is the main type, found in the river and its tributaries. Wildlife is varied and most common types of animals and birds are found. Many are killed on the small country lanes,particulary squirrels&hedgehogs.
